metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23452 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An authorization flaw was found in openstack-barbican, where anyone with an admin role could add secrets to a different project container. This flaw allows an attacker on the network to consume protected resources and cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23452` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

barbican-api - 1:10.1.0-0ubuntu2.1
barbican-common - 1:10.1.0-0ubuntu2.1
barbican-keystone-listener - 1:10.1.0-0ubuntu2.1
barbican-worker - 1:10.1.0-0ubuntu2.1
python3-barbican - 1:10.1.0-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: barbican package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:10.1.0-0ubuntu2.1').
